headline: Global Index Maker MSCI Defers Decision on Dropping Crypto-Focused Companies
summary: MSCI will keep crypto-heavy firms in its indexes through February, deferring changes after investor feedback raised classification concerns.

headline: Should MSCI Index Inclusion And Fresh Bitcoin Buying Require Action From Strategy (MSTR) Investors?
summary: In early January 2026, Strategy Inc. confirmed that index provider MSCI will keep digital asset treasury companies in its benchmarks, while the firm added 1,287 bitcoin funded by fresh common-stock issuance and continued to carry a US$2.25 billion cash reserve despite a US$17.44 billion unrealized loss on digital assets in Q4 2025. This combination of index inclusion relief and continued bitcoin accumulation reinforces Strategy’s dual identity as both a bitcoin proxy and a yield-backed,...

This combination of index inclusion relief and continued bitcoin accumulation reinforces Strategy’s dual identity as both a bitcoin proxy and a yield-backed,...

summary: MSCI has dropped a plan that would have kicked so called digital asset treasury companies out of its equity indexes, opting instead for a wider rethink on how it treats firms that hold large pools of non operating assets such as Bitcoin.The index provider said on Tuesday it will keep ...

headline: MSCI Drops Plan To Exclude Crypto Treasury Companies After Triggering Oct. 10 Crash
summary: MSCI has abandoned plans to remove DATCOs from its global indexes after industry pushback. The original proposal argued that firms heavily holding crypto resembled investment ...

headline: MSCI Keeps Strategy — For Now — But Handcuffs Bitcoin Buying
summary: MSCI adopted a new rule governing Strategy and other digital asset treasury firms that will keep their index weightings from growing as they issue more shares to buy bitcoin.  MSTR stock jumped in after-hours action following the announcement, but only reversed Tuesday's regular-session decline, while bitcoin is a touch lower since the MSCI news.  While headlines indicated a positive outcome for Strategy, MSCI signaled that exclusion of Strategy and similar firms is still firmly on the table.

content.title: MSCI Keeps Strategy — For Now — But Handcuffs Bitcoin Buying
content.summary: MSCI adopted a new rule governing Strategy and other digital asset treasury firms that will keep their index weightings from growing as they issue more shares to buy bitcoin.  MSTR stock jumped in after-hours action following the announcement, but only reversed Tuesday's regular-session decline, while bitcoin is a touch lower since the MSCI news.  While headlines indicated a positive outcome for Strategy, MSCI signaled that exclusion of Strategy and similar firms is still firmly on the table.

headline: Strategy rises as MSCI shelves plans to exclude crypto treasury firms from indexes
summary: Shares of billionaire Michael Saylor's Strategy rose in premarket trading on Wednesday, after MSCI dropped a plan to ​exclude the bitcoin hoarder and other crypto treasury firms from its ‌indexes.  Digital asset treasury companies, often called DATCOs, surged in popularity in 2025 as a wave of firms ‌began holding crypto tokens such as bitcoin and ether as their main treasury assets, lifting prices and giving investors a proxy for direct exposure.  "We believe the most ‌likely middle ground is that MSCI continues to grandfather existing DATCOs already in the Indexes."

content.title: Strategy rises as MSCI shelves plans to exclude crypto treasury firms from indexes
content.summary: Shares of billionaire Michael Saylor's Strategy rose in premarket trading on Wednesday, after MSCI dropped a plan to ​exclude the bitcoin hoarder and other crypto treasury firms from its ‌indexes.  Digital asset treasury companies, often called DATCOs, surged in popularity in 2025 as a wave of firms ‌began holding crypto tokens such as bitcoin and ether as their main treasury assets, lifting prices and giving investors a proxy for direct exposure.  "We believe the most ‌likely middle ground is that MSCI continues to grandfather existing DATCOs already in the Indexes."

headline: The New York Stock Exchange Enters Agreement with MSCI to Become the U.S. Options Listing Venue for Benchmark Indexes in Early 2026
summary: NEW YORK, January 07, 2026--The NYSE announced an agreement to become the U.S. options listings venue for benchmark MSCI indexes in early 2026, pending regulatory approval.

content.title: The New York Stock Exchange Enters Agreement with MSCI to Become the U.S. Options Listing Venue for Benchmark Indexes in Early 2026
content.summary: NEW YORK, January 07, 2026--The NYSE announced an agreement to become the U.S. options listings venue for benchmark MSCI indexes in early 2026, pending regulatory approval.

headline: Strategy Stock Won’t Get Booted From Indexes, MSCI Says. Why That’s Good News.
summary: Shares in major  investor  Strategy  were rising on Wednesday after MSCI iced a plan to exclude crypto treasury companies from its indexes.  The stock, formerly known as MicroStrategy, jumped 4.1% to $164.50 ahead of the opening bell.  Wednesday’s move came after MSCI said late Tuesday that following a consultation it had decided not to bar so-called digital-asset treasury companies, or DATCOs, from its indexes.

content.title: Strategy Stock Won’t Get Booted From Indexes, MSCI Says. Why That’s Good News.
content.summary: Shares in major  investor  Strategy  were rising on Wednesday after MSCI iced a plan to exclude crypto treasury companies from its indexes.  The stock, formerly known as MicroStrategy, jumped 4.1% to $164.50 ahead of the opening bell.  Wednesday’s move came after MSCI said late Tuesday that following a consultation it had decided not to bar so-called digital-asset treasury companies, or DATCOs, from its indexes.

headline: Mobileye to acquire robotics company Mentee, First Solar downgrade
summary: Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance markets and data editor Jared Blikre track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Mobileye's (MBLY) bid to acquire humanoid robotics company Mentee, Jefferies analysts downgrading First Solar (FSLR) to a Hold rating, and Strategy (MSTR) shares rising after MSCI (MSCI) shelved a plan to exclude digital asset-backed treasuries from its indexes. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: Mobileye to acquire robotics company Mentee, First Solar downgrade

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Bitcoin Slips, Strategy Pares Gains On MSCI's New Rule
summary: Equity index manager MSCI will let Strategy and other digital asset treasury firms stay in its global indices for now, but it announced a new rule that could make it harder for them to buy bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies.  MSCI said it won't count new shares issued by Strategy and other digital asset treasury firms, keeping their index weightings from growing as they issue more shares to buy bitcoin.  MSTR stock jumped over 6% in after-hours action following the MSCI news but has given up nearly half that gain.

content.title: Bitcoin Slips, Strategy Pares Gains On MSCI's New Rule
content.summary: Equity index manager MSCI will let Strategy and other digital asset treasury firms stay in its global indices for now, but it announced a new rule that could make it harder for them to buy bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies.  MSCI said it won't count new shares issued by Strategy and other digital asset treasury firms, keeping their index weightings from growing as they issue more shares to buy bitcoin.  MSTR stock jumped over 6% in after-hours action following the MSCI news but has given up nearly half that gain.
